summary: The Camino de Santiago, or the Way of St. James, is a network of pilgrimage routes leading to the shrine of St. James in Spain. Tradition says his remains are buried there. Many people walk, cycle, or take tours along these paths for spiritual growth or adventure. The Camino became popular in the Middle Ages and was officially recognized as one of Christianity's great pilgrimages in 1492. Today, over 200,000 people travel these routes each year, with the French Way being the most popular. UNESCO has recognized parts of the Camino as a World Heritage Site due to their historical and cultural importance.
title: Camino de Santiago
